title: Public transport for the A-League Round 2 - Melbourne City v Melbourne Victory: Saturday 26 October 2024
articleContent:
A-League is back at AAMI Park. This matchup is sure to deliver edge-of-your-seat action. Public transport is your best way to enjoy it, as the Melbourne City FC takes on the Melbourne Victory. Extra services will help you get to and from AAMI Park on Saturday 26th October. 

The event will begin at 7.35pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station:

  • Glen Waverley departing at 9:56pm and 10:06pm from Platform 10 
  • Ringwood departing at 9:58pm and 10:08pm from Platform 9 
  • Sandringham departing 9:54pm from Platform 2 
  • Cheltenham departing 9:56pm and 10:10pm from platform 4 
  • Caulfield departing 10:15pm from platform 4 

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.  

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan bus

Passengers can catch the following buses close to AAMI Park:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Regional train

Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.
